<strong style="display: block;">A company earns $100 million in EBIT, pays $10 million in interest, and faces a 30% corporate tax rate. What is its after-tax income?</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q97" value="D"> D. $55 million</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module8_mcq_q97" value="E"> E. $65 million</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module8_mcq_q97" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: A.  
Taxable income = EBIT − Interest = 100 − 10 = 90  
Taxes = 90 × 0.30 = 27  
After-tax income = 90 − 27 = **$63 million**.
